info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:33AM EDT until May 14 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of north central Maryland, including the following county, Washington and panhandle West Virginia, including the following county, Berkeley.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 AM EDT, stream gauges indicated steady or rising water levels on some area streams and creeks. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hagerstown... Martinsburg... Municipal Stadium... Robinwood... Fountainhead-Orchard Hills... Boonsboro... Smithsburg... Inwood... Paramount-Long Meadow... Wilson-Conococheague... Williamsport... Mount Aetna... Mount Lena... San Mar... Saint James... Long Meadow... Berkeley... Halfway... Maugansville... Cavetown... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... US Highway 11 near Falling Waters Camp, US Highway 11 at Berkeley Station Road, West Moler Ave at Dry Run in Martinsburg, Henshaw Road at Mill Creek, Tuscarora Pike at Back Creek, Allensville Road at Back Creek, US Highway 11 at Evans Run in Martinsburg, Winchester Pike at Route 51, Baxter Road near Tilhance Creek, Route 11 near Fountain Head Plaza, Potomac Avenue near Magnolia Avenue and Toms Run in Clear Spring. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
